responses: Selection bias is a kind of error that occurs when the researcher decides who is going to be studied. It is usually associated with research where the selection of participants isnâ€™t random

Bias is an error introduced in your model due to oversimplification of the machine learning algorithm. patterns: What do you understand by the term Normal Distribution?
I want to know about  Normal Distribution
responses: In a normal distribution the mean is zero and the standard deviation is 1. It has zero skew and a kurtosis of 3
A normal distribution is the proper term for a probability bell curve
Normal distributions are symmetrical, but not all symmetrical distributions are normal

patterns: What is correlation and covariance in statistics?
responses: Both Correlation and Covariance establish the relationship and also measure the dependency between two random variables.

patterns: What are the differences between over-fitting and under-fitting?
responses: Overfitting occurs when a model is excessively complex, such as having too many parameters relative to the number of observations, Underfitting occurs when a statistical model or machine learning algorithm cannot capture the underlying trend of the data
Regularisation is the process of adding tuning parameter to a model to induce smoothness in order to prevent overfitting
Explores the study and construction of algorithms that can learn from and make predictions on data
It is the machine learning task of inferring a function from labeled training data
